dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, have you been keeping an eye on the crypto markets? I mean, wow. Bitcoin's down almost 50% from its April high, and Ethereum, uh, even more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, have you been keeping an eye on the crypto markets? I mean, wow. Bitcoin's down almost fifty percent from its April high, and Ethereum, uh, even more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bitcoin price has lost almost 50% of its value since hitting its all-time high of nearly $65,000 per bitcoin in April. Meanwhile, ethereum is down by more than half after climbing to over $4,000 per ether token earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, A, it's been a wild ride, hasn't it? Like, over half for Ether, that's... that's huge. Makes you wonder, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, A, it's been a wild ride, hasn't it? Like, over half for Ether, that's... that's huge. Makes you wonder, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, ethereum is down by more than half after climbing to over $4,000 per ether token earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But here's the kicker: a leaked report from Wall Street giant, Goldman Sachs. They're saying Ethereum, the second-largest crypto, has a high chance of overtaking Bitcoin as the dominant store of value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But here's the kicker: a leaked report from Wall Street giant, Goldman Sachs. They're saying Ethereum, the second-largest crypto, has a high chance of overtaking Bitcoin as the dominant store of value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, a leaked report from Wall Street giant Goldman Sachs GS +1.8% has given ethereum, the second-largest cryptocurrency with a market capitalization of around $250 billion compared to bitcoin's $660 billion, a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, really? Goldman Sachs? [interrupts] I thought they were, like, traditional finance all the way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, really? Goldman Sachs? I thought they were, like, traditional finance all the way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? But they're calling Ethereum "the Amazon of information." Their analysts are pointing to its 'real uses' as the key.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? But they're calling Ethereum the Amazon of information. Their analysts are pointing to its real uses as the key.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given the importance of real uses in determining the store of value, ether has a high chance of overtaking bitcoin as a dominant store of value, analysts at Goldman Sachs wrote, according to leaked sections of the report shared on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: 'Real uses,' okay. So, like, beyond just being a digital gold? What exactly are they getting at?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Real uses, okay. So, like, beyond just being a digital gold? What exactly are they getting at?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's all about decentralized finance, or DeFi, and non-fungible tokens, NFTs. Most of that, you know, is built on Ethereum. It's actually fueling these applications.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's all about decentralized finance, or D E F I, and non-fungible tokens, N F T s. Most of that, you know, is built on Ethereum. It's actually fueling these applications.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Most decentralized finance (DeFi) applications are being built on the ethereum network, and most non-fungible tokens (NFTs) issued are purchased using ether.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, so it's not just a currency; it's the *platform* for all these new innovations. Like, smart contracts, dApps...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, so it's not just a currency; it's the platform for all these new innovations. Like, smart contracts, dApps...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ethereum ecosystem supports smart contracts and provides a way to create new applications on its platform, the Goldman Sachs analysts wrote.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And get this: over the last 12 months, Ethereum's up about 1,000%, compared to Bitcoin's 300%. Even with the recent dip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And get this: over the last twelve months, Ethereum's up about ten hundred percent, compared to Bitcoin's three hundred percent. Even with the recent dip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the last 12 months, the ethereum price has far outpaced the bitcoin price, with ethereum adding around 1,000% compared to bitcoin's 300%, even when the last week's price crash is taken into account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's a massive difference. But, uh, what about these recent crashes? Doesn't that, like, temper expectations a bit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a massive difference. But, uh, what about these recent crashes? Doesn't that, like, temper expectations a bit?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Good point. But some experts are saying the long-awaited upgrades to Ethereum, which started late last year, could really help it scale and reduce those sky-high transaction costs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good point. But some experts are saying the long-awaited upgrades to Ethereum, which started late last year, could really help it scale and reduce those sky-high transaction costs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meanwhile, some think long-awaited upgrades to ethereum, begun at the end of last year and designed to help ethereum scale and reduce its sky-high transaction costs, could help the ether price reach never-before-seen heights.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, if it becomes more efficient and cheaper to use, that just pushes those 'real uses' even further.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, if it becomes more efficient and cheaper to use, that just pushes those real uses even further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. Kosala Hemachandra from MyEtherWallet put it well: "Unlike Bitcoin, ethereum is not just a value token, meaning it actually fuels all use cases built on top of the ETH blockchain."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. Kosala Hemachandra from MyEtherWallet put it well: Unlike Bitcoin, ethereum is not just a value token, meaning it actually fuels all use cases built on top of the E T H blockchain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unlike bitcoin, ethereum is not just a value token, meaning it actually fuels all use cases built on top of the ETH blockchain, Kosala Hemachandra, the chief executive of MyEtherWallet, said in emailed comments

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Bitcoin's just... a token. Ethereum's the engine. It's a pretty compelling argument for dominance, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Bitcoin's just... a token. Ethereum's the engine. It's a pretty compelling argument for dominance, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, uh, is the 'Amazon of information' really on its way to taking the top spot?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, uh, is the Amazon of information really on its way to taking the top spot?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I guess we'll have to keep watching, but it definitely sounds like a possibility now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I guess we'll have to keep watching, but it definitely sounds like a possibility now.
